docs.snippet: Almost a decade after former KGB officer Alexander Litvinenko lay dying in a London hospital bed, a British judge has concluded who poisoned him: two Russian men, acting at the behest of Russia's security services, probably with approval from Pres...
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost a decade after former KGB officer Alexander Litvinenko lay dying in a London hospital bed, a British judge has concluded who poisoned him: two Russian men, acting at the behest of Russia's security services, probably with approval from President Vladimir Putin.

headline.main: UK Judge: Putin 'Probably Approved' Killing of Ex-KGB Agent
headline.print_headline: UK Judge: Putin 'Probably Approved' Killing of Ex-KGB Agent

docs.snippet: Russia will back an alternative Syrian opposition delegation to negotiate with Syria's government at peace talks in Geneva later this month if the existing opposition team is not reformed or boycotts the talks, a Russian diplomat said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia will back an alternative Syrian opposition delegation to negotiate with Syria's government at peace talks in Geneva later this month if the existing opposition team is not reformed or boycotts the talks, a Russian diplomat said on Thursday.

headline.main: Syria Talks to Start Even if Opposition Boycotts-Russian Diplomat

docs.snippet: Britain will permanently station 1,000 military personnel in Poland from next year, Poland's defense minister said late on Thursday, in an apparent contradiction of an announcement by Britain about plans for temporary exercises on Polish soil....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain will permanently station 1,000 military personnel in Poland from next year, Poland's defense minister said late on Thursday, in an apparent contradiction of an announcement by Britain about plans for temporary exercises on Polish soil.

headline.main: Poland Says to Permanently Host 1,000 British Troops From 2017
headline.print_headline: Poland Says to Permanently Host 1,000 British Troops From 2017
